abstract: Securities and Exchange Commission proposes rules requiring American companies to provide shareholders with standardized metrics in publicly filed annual proxy statements, allowing a comparison between company returns and executive compensation.
lead_paragraph: The rules would require companies to report standardized information, like data on total shareholder return and how it compares against the industry.

headline.main: S.E.C. Proposes Rules on Executive Pay and Performance
headline.print_headline: S.E.C. Proposes Rules to Compare Chiefs’ Pay With Results

snippet: The rules would require companies to report standardized information, like data on total shareholder return and how it compares against the industry.

keywords.value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
